text:
Toggl has somewhat automatic time tracking in the desktop version. In a vertical agenda view of your day, can see which browser tabs you had open at which time, idle periods, etc. It’s quite handy if you forget to track, you can go back and fill in empty time slots. Oh, and you can turn on a reminder to start tracking time every ten minutes if there’s no timer set.

Time tracking is a huge PITA but that makes it easier if you’re only doing it for a couple of weeks. I did find using the dashboards and reporting quite unintuitive, but perhaps I didn’t spend enough time setting up my projects etc.
